main event: On November 1, 1956, in San Luis Obispo, California, a ground-visual observation was made of a round silver object, the size of a pea, which moved straight up from the horizon into the fog after being observed for five minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a pea and exhibited a flight pattern unusual for conventional aircraft.
The sighting lasted for five minutes, allowing for a detailed observation of the object's behavior.
The report suggests that the sighting may have been caused by an aircraft, despite the unusual flight pattern and characteristics of the object.
The observation was made without the aid of any optical instruments, indicating clear visibility of the object.
No photographs were present in the report, which is unusual for a UFO sighting report.
sighted object: round silver object, size of a pea
